screen_desc: The screenshot shows the Amazon mobile website with a focus on early Black Friday deals. The main content highlights banners promoting these deals along with product categories like "Great holiday gifts" and "Home & Kitchen Under $30." Featured items include Oculus products and women’s fashion. The navigation menu allows users to search, access deals, and view account/cart details. The delivery option is set to the Netherlands.
action_think: The user has requested to first clear the cart on Amazon and then add the item 'razer blade' to the cart, followed by proceeding to checkout. The current screen displays the Amazon mobile website with a focus on early Black Friday deals. To start the process, I need to first navigate to the cart to see its contents and clear it if necessary. The cart icon is visible in the top right corner of the screen next to the sign-in option.
action_plan: Click on the cart icon in the top right corner to view the cart contents.
If there are items in the cart, remove each item to clear the cart.
Search for 'razer blade' on Amazon using the search bar.
Select the desired 'razer blade' product from the search results.
Add the 'razer blade' item to the cart.
Proceed to the cart again to review the item added.
Select the option to proceed to checkout.
action_desc: Click on the cart icon in the top right corner to view the cart contents.
action_result:
By clicking on the cart icon located at the top-right, the user has navigated to the shopping cart screen. This action allows the user to review the items in the cart, including the Dell XPS 17 laptop, which is currently the only item in the cart. 

However, this action does not directly clear the cart or add the "Razer Blade" to it. To proceed with the user's request, the next steps would be to remove the Dell XPS 17 laptop from the cart, add the "Razer Blade" laptop, and then proceed to checkout. 

So, while this action has brought the user to the cart page, further actions are needed to complete the request.
